review: Did you say a movie and pizza -- on a rainy day in Atlanta. You can do it all at this location -- and it's kid friendly. Large menu, kids menu -- something for eveyone. And sometimes you are craving a large salad piled high with goodies (that you didn't have to chop) and a pizza and if you go with family or dear friends it's a wonderful family style meal. The staff -- from the front door to the waitstaff and manager were so attentive and friendly. They kept things moving and when one of our dishes was delayed they stayed on the case and kept us informed until they not only corrected the mistake but gave us reason to return. Solid food. Stellar service. We'll be back.

I ate a whole pizza by myself, and downed like five apple martinis in the bargain, all for under $40. The service was excellent, the place clean and quiet, and I remained in the booth by a window undisturbed where I could scarf down my pizza and booze in peace. Also, CPK offers frozen pizzas at Wal-Mart. You're welcome.

I've never been much of a CPK fan, but I did stop by here to meet some friends at Atlantic Station yesterday for a drink. Sitting and the bar, watching the workers in the open kitchen, and enjoying a drink and my company made for an enjoyable afternoon diversion.  Our server/bartender Marissa was really sweet and did a good job chatting us up without being too pushy or annoying us. Her shift ended and we had another guy ring us out, and he was also pleasant. Attentive enough but not in your face.  Jury's out on the food, but the atmosphere was fun and it's definitely a nice place to grab a quick drink in Atlantic Station.

We had a little family outing down in Atlantic Station last Sunday and decided to drop in on Copeland's Bistro for lunch. Well, the wait was 40 minutes long and so then we decided on CPK! I'm glad we did! The wait was a bit shorter, about 15 minutes, and we were seated at a booth near the window in front. Perfect seat. Our waitress was really nice, and after placing our drink orders, she disappeared and a new waitress arrived and let us know the first one had went home for the day. The 2nd waitress seemed distracted by all the commotion. I mean, it was a bit busy, but she couldn't even maintain eye contact with us as we placed our food orders with her. Anywho, eventually our pizzas came out and mmmmmm...  I ordered the Roasted Garlic Chicken pizza, we also had a barbecue, pepperoni, and Japanese with Eggplant pizza. Immediately, we all did a trade-a-thon and sampled each other's pizza. I LOVED the Japanese w/eggplant that my mom had. It was delish! The pepperoni was good (can't really go wrong with that) and the barbecue was ok to me. Mine, the roasted garlic chicken, was really yummy as well. So, all in all, the food was good!  The waiters/waitresses were running around like chickens with their heads cut off. 3 times, 2 different waiters brought somebody else's entrees to our table. LOL! I mean, hey, I'm all for free food but pleeeaaassee, don't tease me! Will drop in again. =)

Not a lot of vegan options but there is one particularly tasty pizza you can get vegan:  The Vegetarian Japanese Eggplant with thin crust and no cheese is completely vegan. Tasty vegetables and good serving size for one or two.

We were headed to Target, so we decided to eat dinner in Atlantic station.  Wanting something healthier, we immediately thought of CPK's salads.  Katie W had already grabbed us a table on the patio.   I was disappointed to see that my favorite offering, the Tricolore Salad Pizza (essentially a house salad with vinaigrette served on top of pizza dough with some kind of delicious slightly cheesy topping) has now gone to a price that I'm not willing to pay when I'm the only one eating it since unlike their other offerings, it does not keep well.  But I was impressed by their small plates menu.  I got the arugula and asparagus salad, which was quite a decent size.  And of course a cup of the tortilla soup.  The service was mediocre, but after all it was late and we were on the patio.   A decent option if you're in Atlantic Station and want something mid-priced as long as you're not pressed for time.

The food is excellent. I usually go with a white pizza or a peach/ candied walnut salad if I'm not in the mood for a bigger meal. However, the prices are high and almost everytime I have went I've needed to wait around for either a check or a refill on a drink.  Last time I went, I ordered take out over the phone and then drove there. When I got there I still ended up waiting ten minutes there before my food was given to me.

Been here a few times. They are always incredibly busy, which is a great indicator. They have a full pizza / pasta menu and daily specials. They also have a full bar.  The food is average quality Italian food. It is just good not great. Great place to go for food before you hit the shopping at Atlantic station or relax with a flick at theater next door.  They also have a full bar. However in our experience the bar service is very slow compared to the food preparation food, so your drinks might arrive after the food, just saying.

A really beautiful place to eat outside. I was there at a trip to Atlanta and my friend recommended this place. We ate 9:00pm but there were still so many people. The spaghetti was so yummy. And the mojito was good too. A great night in Atlanta station!
The food was glorious even though I didn't get pizza. I got some type of garlic pasta with shrimp added & I loved it. It was my first time eating there and I will be returning!

Had lunch here today and the food was just okay. I was really hoping for more. I ordered the Italian Deli sandwich and a frozen strawberry margarita and normally I am in love with this meal. The Italian Deli sandwich comes with ham, salami, and pepperoni on herb cheese focaccia bread. This sandwich is usually amazing and I usually crave this sandwich for weeks to come! While the sandwich was still good, I didn't have the magical warm and fuzzy feeling that I have at the end of my dining experience at California Pizza Kitchen. Both side items are good. I enjoyed my Caesar salad but had the chance to taste the cole slaw and it was by far the best cole slaw I've ever had.  Moving along to my drink, I was so disappointed. The margarita lacked flavor... Maybe the bartender was new. I dunno. Just wasn't feeling it. Overall, the food was good... Just not great. Our server was friendly. I am not ready to give up on CPK... Not just yet. I am hoping it was just a bad day at CPK.

This location has a lot of energy on any weekend night and offers two outdoor patios; our favorite is the one overlooking the park area at Atlantic Station. Friendly staff, great location. Do I really need to go over the food offered here since it's a chain? Didn't think so but just to add a quick comment; I normally stick to the chicken sandwich with their awesome Tuscan styled soup or the vegi pizza. BTW my wife is a vegetarian and gives their vegi panini a double thumbs up. Worth a visit.

I love CPK so much that I have their number saved in my phone (DC and Atlanta locations) just in case I need to order it :"to go." I only order three things....the Spinach Artiochoke Dip (best I ever had) and the CHICKEN JAMAICAN JERK PIZZA, and occasionally the iced tea which you can get in different flavors..yummy. The Jamaican jerk pizza is a party in your mouth...literally. It's sweet with the red, green, and yellow peppers and then a bit of a kick. I remember the waiter would say aren't you going tot try something else? If you don't like it....I'll bring you back the Jamaican jerk....I tried the other pizza and nope! Mine was better. Get it, love it, eat it. Also if you like salads my friends said the Cobb Salad is amazing as well.

i live in atlantic station so it's very convenient for me to just walk over and go to any restaurants in the neighborhood.  i've been avoiding CPK in atlantic station since i moved into the neighborhood 4 years ago.  it's just this location that is lacking in service...very bad service.   on 9/14/2012 (friday), my friends were visiting me and decided to stroll down to get some lunch.  my first choice was to eat at the cheescake bistro but one of the friend insisted we eat at the CPK.  i was hesitant b/c of the service.....i was here 3 times in the past and the service just sucks.  the service at the other CPK isn't like this and actually i love going to other CPK.  i let him know that the service is going to be terrible but he still wanted to eat here. we wanted to sit outside since the weather is so nice.  we got there at 11:45am for lunch.  we were seated right away but we had to wait almost 10 minutes for the waitress named SARAH to notice us.  She took our drink order and went away for another 15 minutes.  After getting our drink with no apology from her that it took forever to get our drink, she took our order.  She disappeared a good 10 minutes and we still haven't got our silverware, no bread and butter.  Every other tables from different waitress got bread and butter and silverware.  My friends weren't happy and i had to rub it in by saying "i told u so".  Finally we flagged her down and told her we needed silverware and some bread and butter.  She was clueless and she just looked at him like he is some kind of alien and left.  Then after a few minutes she did bring us bread and butter.  Once again, no apology.   Two of us ordered the entree salad and the other friend ordered lunch entree.  The salads are $13.50 and the entree lunch chicken is $16.  the soft drinks were $2.50 or $2.95.  I do not know what's taking our salads so long....it took almost 20 minutes to get our food.  i can understand if there were busy but they weren't.  Maybe she was on her cigarette break b/c someone else brought our salads and entree.  Our waitress was clueless the whole time.  This seems to be a pattern at this location.  Very very very bad service.  i had a A-card and usually i get 10% discount and i told her about it and she said she can give me 5% off.  i didn't know set discount is negotiable. it was a joke..... i will not spend over $21 (salad, drink, and tip) for lunch at this place with the service that sucks.  Come on, lunch salad is $13.50? Wow!!!!  oh by the way, when we finally got our check it was 1:31pm.  we were there for 2 hours for lunch b/c the slow service.
Nothing special here....move on unless your hungry and just need a meal. Service was average, place was clean and seated immediately. Pizza maybe a cut above frozen pizza.

I prefer the location at Atlantic Station over CPK at Perimeter.  The wait staff at both locations are friendly, but CPK  Atlantic Station makes better drinks and the crowd is a little different. The Atlantic Station location seems to attract a younger hipper crowd while Perimeter seems to be more casual and family oriented. CPK at Atlantic Station  is within walking distance of trendy retail stores and a movie theater, too.  The pizza and salads are decent and so are some of the appetizers. The dynamite shrimp are Dy-No-Miiight and so are the lettuce wraps!
Everyone knows what CPK is...lets not waste time.  Order the BBQ chix pizza, or Hawaiian BBQ pizza, jambaylaya fetuccine, or any of their salads!  Nuff said, I always order stuff to go...

Bland must be in high demand, man! We ate here so we could sit outside and hear the concerts going on outside at Atlantic Station, it was really the only affordable option to do so with a heated deck. I'd not eaten at a CPK in many years, because the last time I'd went I'd been underwhelmed, but every once in a while you are limited in your options. This was that time. This time, it'd be myself, my wife, and my in-laws.  My wife and I shared two pizzas, the Hawaiian and a Classic Pepperoni. My in-laws split a different pizza. First, the pizza. BORING. BLAND. Very little sauce added to the generic crust, with very little toppings. I understand they were busy, it was a Saturday night after all, but it seemed like it on the plate, and that's never ok. This pizza was no better and almost worst in some ways than frozen pizzas my wife makes at home sometimes. Certainly not worth the ridiculous prices they're asking for these things. Perhaps the BBQ Chicken pizza is slightly more worth it, but the pizzas I ordered sucked. Bad. Crust had no crisp, was chewy in the "previously frozen, thawed out and heated up" way. And man, come on, a little more sauce would have made it at least a smidge better. Then, there was the service, or, lack thereof. Maybe the guy didn't like coming out into the cold air. Whatever the reason, coming to deliver our food and coming to give us our check doth not count for real service. Drinks were not filled, we had to ask for plates to the manager, just a real lack of service at all. Guy was semi-friendly when he was around, just not very much around.  Overall, this is precisely what I remember from this boring, bland chain restaurant. Boring, bland, overpriced food. (It's also hard to believe you could drive five minutes from there and get the best pizza in Atlanta at Antico.)

Its been forever and a day since I ate a CPK. I had no idea this location was even in Atlantic Station.  Gives me one more reason to like the place. We were already at Lenox Square, but they were no longer seating people, so thought we'd have to go to the location near Perimeter, which is in the other direction we were heading, so it was a delight to find this locale. Upon going in we were told there would be a 35 minute wait for a table, but we could sit at the bar if something became available.  Within 5 minutes, I was sitting at the bar and ordering my drink.  We were offered an outside table, but in 35 degree weather in late December, I don't care if there are heaters, I'm not spending $15 on a pizza to sit outside in the cold to eat it.  I've been a fan of the chain, and this visit made me just as much so.  Our waiter, Brent, was not all smiles and charm, but he was efficient, quick, and didn't let us go lacking for anything napkins, honey for our hot tea, water, appetizers, and PIZZA. His facial expression didn't change one bit the entire nite.  Not even when I asked him if he could make me a hot toddy.  He ran down the list of teas, I made my choice and he bought back to me in the nicest presentation.  Just like some high end place.  Small things like that make me happy.  My usual even when I buy CPK pizzas to pop in the oven at home is the BBQ chicken pizza.  I went with it again. I also had a wedge salad that as wedge salads go was fresh, had enough dressing and I was able to share it with my mother.  I don;t go for all the other tasty brands of pizza they hawk.  some places do certain things well, and for CPK its the BBQ chicken pizza.  Compared to the other reviews, I must not be hard to please, the music was pleasant, the food was tasty and the employees were efficient.

Avoid the Jamaican jerk chicken pizza! I ordered this because someone here on yelp recommended it. But it was waaaay toooo sweet, tastes disgusting after a few bites. Sadly Atlantic Station is a desert if you look for high qualify food- I'm not talking about chain fast food here. I would like to go to Westside if I have enough time and want to enjoy a nice meal. Our waitress was friendly but slow and kept forgetting things.  6/100 Yelp 100 Challenge

This CPK might have the worst service ever. I mean, consistently awful. On a previous visit, I had to leave my table twice to search for my server. First because my "full-size" salad had only 2 croutons and then again to ask for the check after the server decided to disappear once again. I really shouldn't be seeking out someone to help me pay for such crap service. Last visit was almost as bad. When my food came, it came without silverware. Then I had to wait for longer than it took me to eat my meal just to get the check. Also, the appetizers are nothing special. I cannot believe all the 5 star reviews this place has! Clearly there's a lot of people who don't eat anything that doesn't come from a chain restaurant. :(
Our waitress wouldn't give me butter for my bread. I find it hard to believe that a restaurant has no butter. I also did not have a chance to see the dessert menu.

During the week they can be pretty slow and you will likely have to ask for bread. My mom was visiting so I asked our server Corey could he take a photo of us for me. The phone was practically in his hand, ready, just had to press the button. He says give him one moment. So I then proceed to watch him walk around. Go here. Go there. Wash hands. Greet. Do this. Do that.  So when he is bringing our CHECK, I ask him about it because I'm confused . He is like, "No, I've just been really busy(btw it's a Tuesday and it's like 2:30pm). But I'm going to take it in a moment. " . He took the photo  before we left but by that time I was already annoyed. I never knew taking a quick photo was such a big deal plus he wasn't that busy. I was watching. Oh and the bread was really hard. My mom asked for softer, fresher bread. He said that was the only bread that they have and because it sits under the lights, all of the bread no matter which one he brings out will be just as hard.

My wife and I had dinner there last night. . When we got there we had a small wait. 20 mins (totally worth it). Doug was our waiter. He gave two great suggestions. the appetizer Avocado/chicken roll was awesome. I had Chicken picado (lemon sauce and spaghetti w capers) it was soooo good and lots of chicken too. my wife had chicken chimichurri (kinda spicy) and the butter cake was the highlight of dinner. Cant wait to go back soon.  The best thing i liked about the place is that there were people from all walks of life in there, eating and working. Great place

CPK no longer offers gluten-free pizza!!  And the waiter insisted on offering gluten-included alternatives:  pastas, wheat flour tacos, ... !!!!!!!   The menu specifically states to ask the Chef for gluten-free alternatives, and he and/or management responded there are none.  Neither had the decency to come to our table. Not to mention that our entire meal, including the portion that the gluten-tolerant guests could enjoy, was tasteless.  We ordered pepperoni pizza, roasted garlic chicken pizza, crispy mac-n-cheese, child grilled chicken and child pastas.  All tasteless. We won't be going back.

I was impressed. I count on CPK when I travel, but this experience was especially good.  Easy parking.  Quick seating.  Great service.  Coke!  Leave it to Atlanta to have my diet Coke rather than Pepsi... Just a personal preference. :).  Kids were happy as always, and I'm always grateful for the vegetarian options including soups at CPK.

Love this place!!! Mouthwatering pizza.The drinks aren't watered down they are soooo good! Every time income here I pig out and get the Asian wrap appetizer and a signature pizza with drinks and end up eating everything so yummy! This is definitely my fav spot to eat in Atlantic Station

Following our awful experience across the way at Rosa Mexicano (see my last review) we were starving even more than we had been earlier.  And needless to say, we were eager to have any semblance of a decent meal and would almost settle for halfway-decent service. We had never been to CPK despite all the good things we had heard, so we decided to give it a shot. We were seated right away and greeted by our waiter "Really Good Actor".  My wife asked him to repeat his name, and sure enough he said it again: "Really Good Actor". Never caught his real name, but I'm gonna go out on a limb and assume he is an aspiring Thespian.  Either way, he was a very nice enthusiastic server who lifted our spirits, and I hope his acting career takes off. Drinks were obviously made with high-end ingredients and were not watered down at all.  If you're looking to get a buzz before dinner, try the Top Shelf Long Island Iced Tea.  There was a minor issue with my wife's drink, but RGA took care of it right away. For appetizers we got the Tortilla Spring Rolls.  Fresh, flavorful and just downright good.  That Thai peanut sauce was awesome all by itself. I had the Jambalaya Fettuccine, and when I ordered it RGA got a look on his face of excitement that told me this was one of his favorite dishes.  And I saw why.  Perfect Cajun spices that weren't over-the-top hot; perfectly-cooked pasta and lots of shrimp, sausage, chicken and crawfish.  It seemed to get better and better the closer I got to the bottom of the bowl.  Hope my wife wasn't embarrassed because I HAD to grab some bread and sop up the rest of that sauce.  It would have been a shame to waste it!   RGA suggested the butter cake for dessert.  His exact words were "it's a beast".   It is indeed... Think of the best pound cake you've ever eaten, and then think of that cake on steroids.  Heat it up and throw some Haagen Daz on top then drift off into a sugar coma. Great dining experience for food and service.  We will be back.

I've always liked CPK but I rarely eat there because they served Pepsi.  When I heard that they switched to Coke (at least in Atlanta) I decided to head over to celebrate. My daughter and I sat at the bar.  Service was super friendly. We had a thai chicken pizza and an ice cream sundae. The Thai is my favorite and I will say it wasn't as good as I remember.  It seemed a little dry.  It was decent but not crave-worthy as I remember. The ice cream sundae was really good.
Located in atlantic station, this is the only cpk I've been to so far. We went there on a winter evening with friends. Tried the jerk chicken pizza and couple of other pizzas. Ambience was great.

The service is always spot on. I typically go here for lunch close to when they first open.  Sometimes the music has been loud or room too chilly but with a quick request to the server the music has been turned down or temperature raised. They are very knowledgeable about their menu and all meals I have eaten here were delicious!

Monday night walked in at 8p. Not full at all. However, poor service (extremely slow & inattentive staff), unprofessional (staff didn't seem to be communicating well and our server was extremely flustered by another table and took it out on us, and I saw a waitress preparing a dish WHILE eating over the prep station!), lukewarm food. I've had much better service at other CPKs. I wouldn't waste another life minute at this place.

Great place! Friendly staff.  CPK is right in the middle of Atlantic Station. The food is amazing and always looks great. Tequila Chicken Pasta is amazing and the Thai Crunch Salad is the best salad I've ever had.

My chapter utilized this CPK location for a fundraiser. It took us forever to get someone to get that together for us but...yeah. We all came here as a group on our fundraising day and our waiter (I cannot remember his name to save my life and that is sad because I've had him as a waiter more than one) was excellent. He always makes sure to put the drink specials out there, which is great if you had a hard day at work. He suggested that I try a different pizza than my norm-the pear Gorgonzola...it was okay but had no meat and I needed some chicken in my life that day. So he replaced the pizza with my favorite Jerk Chicken pizza with no problem. Overall our event was great and the service was wonderful. Thank you CPK! #Yelp100

California Pizza Kitchen is home to one of my favorite salads- the roasted vegetable salad. It's a delightful concoction of warm, roasted veggies, avocado, and artichokes. I could eat it every day. I also really enjoy a few of their appetizers, including their hummus. I know CPK is a chain, but I'm still picking up what their putting down. It's just good food. They use fresh ingredients, have vegetarian and vegan options, and pretty good service, too. This particular location is usually slammed. I have had to wait for a table before, but usually only for a few minutes.  This is a convenient place to grab something healthy, or not so healthy to fuel your shopping at Atlantic Station.

Stopped by this place after watching a movie at the cinema close by. Friend and I ordered one pizza each: the classic buffalo chicken and the wild mushroom. Both were alright but seemed a tad bit overpriced for a dominos quality pizza. Pizzas were around 10" (6 slices, thin crust). Would only come back if I were desperate for food and didn't mind paying so much for so little.

I love CPK but I hadn't been to one is Atlanta yet. I was talking the place up to my boyfriend so I finally took him to the one in Atlantic Station for dinner last Thursday night and to my pleasure, it was just as good as the ones I had been to in other areas. I got the Hawaiian pizza, which I had never had (from CPK) and it was delicious. Big slices of ham and pineapple all over the pizza, definitely no skimping on toppings here. My boyfriend ordered the Sicilian, which looked even better and devoured it, so it must've been good. haha  While their pizzas may be smaller and more expensive then other pizza places, you have to remember all of their pizzas are hand made (the dough and everything) and baked wood fire oven. If you want take out pizza for $7 that's cool, but the quality is what makes CPK's pizza prices a little more.  I also am in love with their Avocado Club Egg Rolls! My best friend and I used to order these if we didn't want pizza along with another small plate and just eat those for lunch/dinner. I have also had their salads, which are all pretty good from what I remember but haven't had them in a while. If you want to go to a pizza place that is a step above your typical take out pizza (Papa Johns, Dominos, etc) then this is a great chain to consider giving a shot and they have so much more then just pizza.

We stuck to appetizers here, and they were okay. The Avocado Club Egg Rolls were alright, but there was barely any chicken in there.  The Fish Tacos were pretty good, but the sauce was too watery. The chips and salsa that came with it: Salsa was good, but chips were too salty! Then we signed up for the CPK card and got the Spicy Chicken Quesadilla for free. It was not that great.

Stopped here on a Sunday night. My friend ordered the Avocado Club Egg Rolls, which we were told they were out of. So, we order our main courses.  Our waitress brings out my friend's pizza on the wrong crust and says she's sorry for the lack of communication in the kitchen, but did he want another one made? He says no. 20 mins later she brings out ANOTHER pizza (one on the correct crust that my friend said not to remake) She apologizes and asks if he just wants it to go. We weren't going straight home so we say no. It was just disorganized....

I love the California signature pizza! I will forever order that pizza from this place. All the other pizzas I've tried didn't stand up to it. I've tried the chipotle, 3 meat, and Hawaiian. The tiramisu dessert was ok. The service was ok. Oh! The strawberry lemonade is pretty darn good compared to other joints! It's not too sweet nor too sour.

I'm giving this CPK 3 stars because the food was seasoned. I got the jambalaya pasta which I couldn't finish due to the overly powerful "sauce," as the menu so pleasantly described it. I liked the flavor, but it was just too damn harsh! I tried my best to kill it, guys! I did! My poor taste buds just had to tap out. I'd describe it as a very....VERY strong file (gumbo) flavor. I don't want to totally give up on this location because it's like a piece of home, so I'll go back and give the dish another shot. Maybe the cook who made the batch of "sauce" that day was tired. Very tired.

If you are in the Atlantic Station, stop by California Pizza Kitchen and ask for Brandon to be your server. We informed him that we were in a rush for a quick dinner since we had a movie screening to attend. He was attentive to our needs and quite fast. We were in and out in 35 minutes thanks to him.

I got the white pizza, okay it was a little bit greasy. The pizza just wasn't very good. The spinach on it tasted really bitter, idk if it went bad or what but it tasted worse than medicine. And the Long Island ice tea I got was really weak and watered down. This is a good place to have conversations though. Maybe just an appetizer and some fountain drinks next time ?

A friend, from out of town, and I went here after I raved about the pizza. Unfortunately,  the experience was a disaster.  The server first told us that pitchers of beer were served and even listed a few beers. Then she brought the bar menu over and when we asked where the list of pitchers were she changed and said they didn't serve them.  After that she ignored us and we waited to order. The pizza took a little while, by the time we finally got it (with our drinks, mind you) it had been over 45 minutes.  To top things off, the server started stacking our plates and tool the pizza away when we were still eating it! I've been in the restaurant business for over 5 years now and I was so appalled at this service. I am normally a 25%+ tipper but this server made my guest and myself so unwelcome...I do not like feeling pushed out the door.

Terrible experience. Hostess looked away. And completely ignored us when we walked in, then server hounded us by taking our plates away before we were finished. Then they wouldn't validate parking! Never coming to this location again. I'd give them negative stars if I could.

CPK is a go-to for lunch before a movie or shopping. Today was disappointing not because of the food but the service. That's why it's only 2 stars. The service drug the number down badly. It was a Saturday but not slammed. Unfortunately my friends and I had a server who clearly had a lot of other places she wanted to be. Bummer. Get a good server and try the BBQ pizza or the Spinach & Artichoke thin crust though. I will give it another chance but they won't get a third. Too many other good places around who would be glad to take my money.

Caution: go to the restaurant next door!!!! My friends had been raving about this place for a while so when my family was deciding on a place to eat I thought why not? Its a chain so it couldn't be that bad...wrong.  The food was mediocre at best, probably around 2 stars for the amount and price. The service was about zero stars. We walked in and had to search for the hostess ourselves. After 15 minutes (there were empty tables everywhere) we were seated at a table only set up for 3 and just ended up grabbing chairs from the table over because she was slow and we had 3 young, cranky, and hungry children in tow. It took the waiter another 15 minutes to bring room temperature water with no ice and the rest of the meal did not go better. I still tipped our waiter in the end but apparently it wasn't enough to compensate for his lackluster performance and he rudely and quite loudly complained to the other waitstaff and then was bitingly sarcastic as we were walking out. Needless to say we are not going back. I have never experienced service this bad before in my life and honestly you are better off going to the restaurant next door.

I usually love CPK, but this location turned me off the brand for its poor service and underwhelming food. While the food was not as good as I remember, it was the lackluster service that truly put the nail in the coffin for future visits. It took awhile for the hostess to seat us (I wasn't sure where she was/went to) and when she finally did arrive, she did not apologize for our extended wait. We were sat at a table outside where we felt completely ignored by our waiter. It took him around 15 minutes to come say Hello and get our drink orders (Note: it was NOT busy in the restaurant). Then while waiting nearly 45 minutes for our food, our drinks were refilled only once on a hot summer day. I had higher expectations because of the CPK brand, but I will think twice before visiting and will definitely NOT be returning to this location!

#tellingyouwhatithink #dpursuitisreal Visited Saturday during @AtlanticStation hustle and bustle of the back to school bash. Had awesome weather and since I live in the area decided to venture out among the living to grab lunch.   Since this spot was convenient and had an inviting patio,  I decided to give it a try.   Service was great.  I was seated immediately and my order was taken as soon as I was ready.  I ordered a specialty margarita from the menu.  It was tasty.  Not BOOM memorable to the point I ordered another one but not a disappointment either.   I ordered spicy soft pork tacos with fresh avocados.  They were simply spicy. No other flavor or nice taste to them. Just EXTREMELY spicy.  Sooooooo... The other menu items weren't appealing to me so I'm not sure I'll visit anytime soon.

Unless you have a really huge appetite, small plates are the way to go. I ordered the White Corn Guacamole and the Asparagus & Arugula Salad. Not only where they delicious, but also fulfilling. I replaced the chips with the traditional pita chips that they cook upon order. I had a nice simple dinner for $10.
The Hawaiian chicken bbq was good with red onions, fresh cilantro and pineapples... the  Belgian chocolate shuffle cake was good too.. and the service was excellent.. so fun..
CPK is a solid option for pizza and salad.  I used to order salad from here to go like once a week!
I really like CPK and the food here is good like their other locations.  A few outdoor seats but a nice bar to sit at.  It's what you expect and I like it a lot

Although it's a chain, this location had really good lettuce wraps and spinach dip for appetizers. Everyone In our party had something different for dinner and everyone enjoyed their meal . Good service and outside table and a decent beer selection.

I definitely enjoy a good pizza, of which they have plenty! If you haven't tried the BBQ Chicken pizza, it's a must! My biggest issue with this restaurant is making up my mind on what I want. Sometimes it can get a bit busy, given the location, but it's definitely worth it if you have the time! Oh, and try the soups!

Great location in a high end area doesn't necessarily mean good food. Last night I had the smallest and the most expensive frozen pizza, or at least that's what it tasted like. Inedible after two bites. At first, I thought I was the only one and I shouldn't fuss, but when I looked around,  I counted six more tables besides mine who had their crusts put aside as the couldn't eat them. All in all, I spent $100 on some frozen pizzas last night and I will never do that again.

Um maybe I didn't have a good experience because it was the holidays.... My waiter was not very friendly, they cramped me and my kids in this back overflow room and the college kids that we were sat by weren't very nice. I'll try it once more in the daytime and see how my next experience is. Food was good though!

This was where I had my first date with my current bf. We didn't have much of a waiting time. We were seated on the booth tables and noticed other couples in our area.  We got the BBQ Chicken Pizza and Club Pizza. Both tasted equally well. There were a lot of toppings topping the Club Pizza lols.  Service was great too. We took out the leftover Club Pizza and we were pleasantly surprised to see that there were re-heating instructions on the take-out box, very useful!
Good food and drinks, service could be faster tho. Usually have the letter chicken wraps witch are delish, really like this place, will be back for more.

The food is pretty good and waiter staff is also really knowledgeable about the food as well. The only drawback is that the drinks are really weak. It's ok to have drinks where you don't taste the alcohol but they don't have the punch or effect that they should. First and foremost its a restaurant so that's the key their success. So you shouldn't go in there expecting to get a buzz or get drunk. With that said every dish I've gotten from them has been astounding. So my recommendation is always go there if you're in the area and want some good food.

I've had food in several of their locations, but most often in their Atlantic Station branch and I've also tried many different menu items and have never been disappointed. Their Tiramisu is exceptional! When I was a poor graduate student, a monthly Tiramisu from CPK made me so happy! I'd go here as soon as I got my paycheck every month.

Every Sunday I instinctively begin craving pizza. So while my husband and I were in the Atlantic Station area Sunday evening, I knew what I would be having for dinner. California Pizza Kitchen was in the area, so it was a convenient choice!  The pizza was good! I chose the California Club since I love something fresh with my pizza. The hubby got Jamaican Jerk Chicken. Both were tasty. The server was nice and speedy. It was clean. All the things you expect from a major chain restaurant. We enjoyed our dinner!  (I usually don't review major chain restaurants since I feel I can only give most of them a 3 star review because it's kind of expected of them to have all the elements of a decent dining experience.)

Just ordered from there using" food to you" and I'm Not pleased my order was incomplete and the fact you close in 10 minutes I have no time to get my ice cream that's missing from my dessert. The food quality is okay .. I pictured the BBQ Pizza being better . I hope my pound cake is better once  I get ice cream from the store . Not pleased and I normally love CPK..
Very nice place Love the Chix lettuce wraps. Friendly bartenders always good service.

I was in Atlanta for my senior trip, and this place looked like the best place to eat in the area. Our server was really nice. He got my friends and I virgin strawberry margaritas. The avocado egg rolls are fantastic! The pizza is also unique and wonderful. We got the Caribbean jerk chicken pizza? Something like that. Anyway, this was a wonderful experience. If I ever see another California Pizza Kitchen, I'll be going back.

I actually like this chain. I always stick to my key favorites like a pizza, the Cobb salad, and the butter cake (drool). The chains that I've been to have always provided pretty good service. However this location has had more lackluster service. It's ok and you'll get your food, but some of the folks there seem to not want to be at work. I would visit this location if a group of friends were going, bust actually coming back on my own merit is highly unlikely.

Tried and True - that is how I assess CPK. I've been eating at different CPK all over the country and you can always count on a very good meal here. They don't deviate from the "formula" for food or service and that's what makes it so enjoyable to eat here. I haven't been in a while, but it is as good as I remembered. I had the Roasted Veggie salad and of course the portion was huge and filling. I could eat that salad every day!! Absolutely delicious and also tried the Crispy Thin Crust Sicilian Pizza - meat heaven and just spicy enough which was great. I really enjoy this place and look forward to coming back again soon.
Great pizza!    You can split a pizza since all are 10inch or 6 slices. Inside and outside seating a full bar and great service.

I'm fairly certain I've eaten here before, but it has been many years before. The bf and I went here to grab dinner with his friend, but we chose this location because of the Improv in the Park that happens every 1st Wed of the month. I think this mostly occurs during the summer so check it out before coming out.  The service here was attentive and great. The food was pretty good; it wasn't super super awesome or divine but merely good. Some of the pizza creation was unique: Thai chicken and the pear gorgonzola. The pizza size here was funky: it is between a personal pan pizza and a medium pizza. I chose the pear gorgonzola (a type of cheese). It had unique ingredients and tasted unique as well. The hazelnut slices (?) atop the pizza gave it an interesting texture as you take the 1st bite. The pear was sweet, and the cheese had a slightly bitter taste. It was sort of like blue cheese.  The bf's Thai pizza was also unique. If you use the dip, it will be super spicy. Without it, it was somewhat plain. There was also a rewards membership that you can sign up for. For every $100, you get a percentage back. Parking is free for the 1st 2 hours and thereafter you're on your own.

Quick update is that they have a "small plate" menu weekdays, prices from around $6-8, with options from flatbreads to salads. If you download the CPK app, your first is free! Do it, (delete it later or whatever), and have a lunch or snack on the house. The spinach and mushroom flatbread and the arugula salad are great.  Lunch, done and done.

Very overrated! My family and I decided to dine here for the first time and I'm certain we won't be back. $13 for a basically a personal size pizza is absurd! The service was decent but you do not get your monies worth. We left still hungry!
Veggie pizza was really tasty. The pear and arugula pizza proved to be a good combination! Waiter was quite good-very friendly and took great care of us!
Decent food but bad seRvice...ordered a Carrabien sunset a sangria..looks good but didn't have any wine in it

Stopped in here for a quick drink after dinner and a movie with friends. Do people who work at these restaurants not know what Yelp is? Do they not know that we can see the name of the restaurant, the address, their name tags, etc and could easily tell the world "no matter how hungry/thirsty/lush-ish you may feel, so not eat/drink at ______?" Sat down with a friend (at the bar) and waited a good 15 minutes for the bartender to bring a menu. When he finally did come over, he floated by while saying "what are you having?" No introduction. No "would you like a water to start?" Just floating and a question. When we finally ordered our drinks, he sat them down and we haven't seen him since. He hasn't come back to ask if we needed anything else or even if we like the drinks. I'm sitting at justin's bar right now writing this review as I wait on his manager to come through so I can drop these jewels in his/her ear. On a side (and totally unrelated note), I'm seeing a LOT of women coupled up with some super fine ass Black men and I'm wondering if they're imports. I don't see these levels of fine when I'm out and about in the city. Maybe I should sit in the middle of the road with a sign that says "I'm fertile and available." I can assure you that if I wasn't single, I wouldn't have time to write these reviews. PS: the manager just left and comped our drinks. Update two: Ashley gave us meal cards to come back and justin's ashy ass still hasn't spoken to us even though he's standing right in our face.

So after leaving the nail spot I got hungry. This was my choice and a damn good one at that. I ordered the flatbread with spinach, artichoke and chicken..... Mmmmm. How ever my 9oz glass of Pinot had something in it stuck to the glass....

For a chain, California Pizza Kitchen does everything right, IMO. The food and service is always excellent, consistency like that is definitely uncommon.  Was here tonight with some girlfriends for dinner and drinks and we all had a wonderful time. Our drinks were strong and tasty, our entrees were just as delicious.  I ordered the shrimp scampi pizza, and my girlfriends had the roasted artichoke and spinach pizza with chicken, the works pizza, and the jambalaya pasta. There was even room for dessert, we ordered the butter cake with vanilla ice cream. HEL-LO! I'd go back JUST for that, ish was amazing. They didn't disappoint, we'll most certainly be back.  Also shout out to our beautiful waitress Luckii, she was awesome.

Like always, my food was wonderful! I ordered the chicken and shrimp penne and a mojito. However, I am slightly disappointed that it took 45 minutes to get seated when the hostess said 20 min wait. when we finally got a table my party of 5 couldn't fit at the table. I had to pull up a chair and I was in the aisle :( I kept getting hit in the back and someone's kid even fell on me. I will return again but most likely not with a group .

The server, the hostess and the other waitresses were awesome. The manager Ashley sucks! I loved the food. We were sitting outside and there was a group of 4 or 5 people sitting at a table near us and were being extremely loud, almost defining. The other patrons were looking at these people and you could tell some were very uncomfortable. I asked one of the waitresses to ask the manager if she can ask them to lower their voices, instead Ashley, the manager comes over to us and asks us if we want to move inside. I told her no, I would prefer if you can ask them if they would please quiet down. She never did, she just asked if they were okay, didn't even bother checking on any of the other patrons there were outside. She also pointed out that this was the first time she heard about it! SMH!!!! Next time I decide to go I am asking if she is working first and if she is I will go elsewhere.

Amazing food. I got the garlic Alfredo pasta with chicken and extra sauce and my wife got the artichoke pizza. We also got sangrias, white and red. They are absolutely amazing. I would never recommend this place not only for peace but also for their pasta. Great great food for the price

Consistency is important to me. I pick up a Moroccan Chicken Salad about 3Xmonth from this CPK location and about 1Xmonth from the Perimeter Mall area location. Always good...always the same quality. The wait is the only inconsistent challenge at times.
Thanks Jacquez!!! Food: great...ambience:awesome...service: it doesn't get any better than this!!

I enjoy coming here, on the rare occasion I do. The pizza (and other food) is unique nd good. It looks small, but packs a powerful punch, specifically if you order pizza. As always, god service as well. Like the nice cool casual vibe.
Food is okay but the place is extremely disgusting. They need to spend a whole day cleaning that place. Even my 7 year old told me it's dirty.

What an experience I had. This was my first time eating at this restaurant and I was very impressed. We waited about 40 minutes due to the location (Atlantic Station) but it was worth it. The greeter was very pleasant she checked in with us several times throughout our wait. She offered several different options to accommodate us. When we were seated we were even more impressed with our server. She was fabulous. I'm sorry I was so involved with my family that I can't recall the names of our greeter or server. The restaurant was super busy and as busy as it was, it was clean. Thank you to a great staff that smiled as they went buy. If you love salads please try the Thai Crunch Salad. It has rice sticks, peanuts, wontons, cilantro....so YUMMY!!!!

I always enjoy my experience here every time I come! I usually take a seat at the bar and Alex is always a very big help in assisting with my order and recommendations. He's a big part in my return service. One of the better CPK establishments!

The worst experience to date!!! At 8 PM I ordered a Thai chicken pizza with a substitute of shrimp instead of chicken ( I DON'T eat CHICKEN) I wrote very specifically in my order instructions...."NO chicken please I only want shrimp on it... I know there is an up charge I will pay for it"... At 9:45 I received a very cold, very shifted pizza with chicken all over it. At that time the restaurant had closed for business... However the delivery service was able to reach someone. They were told they made the pizza exactly as it was supposed to be. And they refused to refund me my  money.  So I was left with a pizza I COULD NOT eat... A hunger headache an empty stomach and no dinner... And a refused refund!!!  EXTREMELY UNHAPPY!!!!

Terrible experience. When the pizza came right out we were surprised at the speed. However, it was cold. Not hot, not warm, not even room temperature, it was cold to the touch. They either gave us somebody elses pizza that had been sitting a while or pulled something out of a refrig and forgot to heat it up or the mind can come up with worse. I informed the waiter who took it it back and came back WITH THE SAME PIZZA 5 minutes later. Really? It was now room temperature. Didn't have the time to keep this up. We had a show to catch so we chewed through the dried out mess. It actually had good flavor. Wow, epically bad to serve that up though...
Worst gluten-free pizza I've ever had. Ate here out of convenience, having just attended an event at Atlantic Station. Terrible service, too. If you have any dignity, skip this place.

I have been to multiple CPK around Georgia and I would say this place is the best one out of all of them! Their service is always fantastic on the days I have gone, typically a weekday. Me and a close friend recently visited and our server was so amazing I had to leave a review. The food is unique and scrumptious. We had the Mac and cheese bites which were meh, wouldn't recommend. Also one pasta and one pizza dish, both were pretty delicious. I would highly recommend swinging by for a nice lunch if your in the area! TL;DR: The service is always on point on the weekdays and the food is excellent! I wouldn't recommend the Mac and cheese bites but would recommend checking this place out.

Absolutely horrible service. The Yelp app for this restaurant had a thing to click that says free small plate when you sign up. I signed up and then the waiter Nick was a total asshole to me about it. Apparently you have to wait for the next visit. That wasn't on the deal on Yelp, but I signed up for the rewards program. The manager stopped by and told me that their system couldn't update fast enough which is why they want it on the second visit. He said he'd run my rewards card and see if it was there, and it was! Win for me. After asking about the rewards thing, the waiter Nick didn't return to the table. The manager had to bring us silverware that he never brought. We never had our drinks refilled. After the app and pizza came to the table, it took about 45 minutes for the free small plate to come. We practically had to wave Nick down to get our bill. He couldn't be bothered to wait on our table anymore. I think in the hour we were there he took the order and dropped off the check. Basically not another word. It was really disappointing that all of this was over a $5 small plate. They shouldn't have the alert on yelp to sign up to get a free small plate if they don't want to honor it. I guess there's no real reason to have signed up for the rewards program since I'm pretty much over the whole chain.

Wow! Had a great dining experience here. We have been to CPK at Lenox Mall several times and this one is much better. We had Corey and he was amazing!! He told us about the CPK club which was never mentioned at the Lenox location. Also offered Parmesan cheese when our pizza arrived. The service seems to be better managed here. Pizza was one just right!! Kudos to Corey! We will be back!

Absolutely loved this place. They seated us quickly and right away asked what we would like to drink. The food was great and I adored our waiter. Sadly I do not know her name. Highly recommend this place (:
Stopped in here for a quick lunch before catching the Cirque show and we got a thin pizza that was pretty good. Good service as we were in a hurry and they helped us stay on time

Horrible service.  I can't  comment on the food.  We never ordered any.  The waiter came over and said he'd be right with us after sitting for 10 min.  We then waited an additional 5 min and decided to leave.  Customer service is the life blood of the success of a restaurant, especially when I dont get to the point where I get to actually experience the food.

Great service, the food was fast (which was very convenient because we were grabbing a snack before a movie) and delicious as usual! If you're a fan of this chain then you definitely won't be disappointed in this one.

We stopped here on a trip to Atlanta. The whole experience was subpar. It was dinner time on a Friday night. When we walked in, the hostesses looked bored and one had a drink sitting on top of the hostess station, which I find sloppy and unprofessional. We were seated at a booth with a giant tear in the seat. The menus were very worn out and were dirty with food residue. They are card stock, so they shouldn't be that expensive to replace when they're past their prime. When my husband tried to order one of the craft beers that was advertised on a chalk board, our server said they were out of all the local craft beer draft options. Our table top felt sticky, and the floors were dirty. The spinach dip we ordered was oily and not great. To be fair, our pizza was good. Our server was nice, but the service was slow and my water glass was empty for a loooong time. I'm not a super picky person, but all of these things combined left me underwhelmed at best. I've been to the Nashville CPK and had great experiences, but I'm going to pass on this particular location in the future.

Great place! Clean, organized environment with a nice ambience - the open kitchen makes it cool to watch them cook the pizzas. The portion sizes are huge, enough to take home for a second meal. Big shout out to Brittany at the bar for going out of the way to make me a drink that was not on the menu, and for the great suggestions and accommodations when it came to my vegan diet restrictions. It's rare to find someone who really cares and is so willing to help me figure out a vegan option, it was an awesome experience and I'll be coming back.

Horrible service. I ordered with the App Eat24 and they forgot 1 meal from order. They refused to give it to the driver who was at the restaurant so it could be delivered to me. Never had a problem before this is really bad will not be ordering delivery from them again.

I stopped in this location with 2 other ladies on a Monday afternoon. It wasn't busy at all. When we first sat down our server was very attentive at getting us water and putting our orders in. However, I ordered the Shrimp Zucchini Scampi which basically included shrimp,zucchini, and some Alfredo yum! To my surprise I was disappointed. My dish had NO ALFREDO what so ever. It was just all zucchini and maybe 4-5 baby shrimps. Not only that, but I found 2 shrimp tails and a few pieces of penne pasta here and there. I didn't feel the need to complain as our server didn't come back that much after that. I don't even know if they actually cooked that plate fresh, or just gave me someone's leftovers. And let me tell you... The portions are TINY. You're better off spending a couple dollars more at a better restaurant. Avoid this location!

Service was great, we are fasting and couldn't meet till a certain time, the waiter was prompt and understanding and got all our devices pastas and pizzas out right in time for us to break fast. We especially liked the barbecue chicken pizza! The chicken tequila pasta was also a favorite

I know it's hard to get excited about a chain restaurant, but I'm giving this place 5 stars for amazing service. Our group of three came hungry with only 40 minutes to spare before our movie at Atlantic station. We asked our server if it'd be possible to get us in and out in that amount of time and he totally delivered. He's the best, and I'll remember in the future that CPK the place to go in Atlantic Station when you're in a hurry to catch a movie

FOOD/DRINKS: CPK has an extensive menu and offers something for everyone. The food is very flavorful and tasty. The are good options for drinks as well; both alcoholic and non-alcoholic. SERVICE: The servers are knowledgeable, attentive and friendly. ATMOSPHERE: Casual and family oriented. Great for groups and children. LOCATION: CPK is located inside of Atlantic Stations which offers free parking for 2 hours  PERKS: Sign up for CPK Pizza Dough Rewards and you will get a free small plate.
Yummy pizzas and salads! This was my first time eating "California style pizzas".

Food is always great consistent  The service is always slow and bad!  Ordered the corn guacamole for starters  Chipotle chicken pizza  Butter cake with ice cream $2 more The appetizer and pizza were brought out together after about 30 min  The ice cream was half a scoop of normal small size you can get outside you get more icecream in mcd soft serve cone for $.75  Love the food which there was better service  The server took around 20 minutes to come get our order he was taking to go orders on that booth ringing up customers, finally had to grab another waiter n say pls take our order. Guacamole was4.5/5  Pizza as always 5/5  The butter cake 5/5  Icecream scoop 1/5 tastes really good but size.

Came in on a late afternoon with the kids. After ordering they asked for bread. Their food arrived quick. We asked for bread again. No bread available. When My salad  arrived it was missing avocado. Got the avocado and asked for bread for my salad. Was then told they had to make it. It was approximately 30min from our first bread request to find out they were now putting it in the oven. Of course I was almost done with my salad. There was too much dressing and I really needed and wanted bread to go with it.  Never really had a good dining experience here, we only go because the kids love it. I guess this will be my last time dining here!

If you want to go to a California Pizza Kitchen, go to the one at Lenox. Waited for 10 minutes after we were seated for out waiter to come by. Pasta was dry. Bathrooms were disgusting. We were surrounded by screaming children. However, dessert was amazing. The butter cake is to die for!

I really do love this location. It's right in Atlantic station near Copelands. They have plenty of indoor and outdoor seating (when the weather is nice). I usually always get the same thing every time I come which is the Spicy Chipotle Chicken Pizza. My daughter always gets the same thing as well just cheese and pineapples. As for as appraisers I've tried the avocado egg rolls, the lettuce wraps, crispy Mac and cheese, and the buffalo cauliflower. They are all pretty good I keep them in rotation when I go. When I feel like being healthy I'll get the blacked salmon Caesar salad which is really good. They usually have complementary bread w/ olive oil but they were out when I was there 2 days ago. The service is usually pretty good. BUT the last two times I went I did see 1. Two of the cooks about to get into a fight (which was kinda entertaining). & 2. My server was not attentive and really nonchalant which was annoying to me. I don't believe the validate parking but you do get 2 free hours when u get there which is usually plenty of time to eat and go. Or they have street metered parking which is what I usually opt for. It's $3 for 2hrs. Overall 4 stars.

First time coming to this California Pizza Kitchen and will definitely be my last. The service was not good. The server barely checked up on the table. I could see him standing in the corner using his cellphone most of the time and of course it was hard to get his attention to come to the table. Only came to the table twice: once because I needed napkins, second because I needed the check. He didn't ask if we needed refills or anything. The food (pizzas) were very hard to cut through and were sort of cold. Overall, won't be coming here again due to the service and food.

Called here to place a to-go order and was greeted by the most condescending, miserable person ever - named Kathy. When I asked for fettuccine with spinach noodles, she harshly corrected me saying "you mean spinach fettuccine?" Then, she asked if I wanted any toppings. I informed her which ones I would like and asked if she could make sure they put an adequate amount on the pasta b/c in the past I've gotten very little. She very rudely says that the amount of toppings I get is in accordance with the price of the dish, so I'll get what I get. Totally fed up with her attitude at this point, I  told her to forget the whole order. Will NEVER patronize this location again.

Today at about 3pm my guest and I dined at the bar of this location. The bartender on duty at the time was Seth. First of all, upon entering the building somehow I became the host because I first had to acknowledge the young lady before she acknowledged me, the guest. She then proceeded to, in a less than pleasant tone direct us to the bar because there "weren't any tables". Reluctantly we complied, not because we'd intended on sitting at the bar, but because we felt like we had no other choice. We get to the bar and order fairly quickly. The beverage I ordered, the strawberry mango cooler, which I've had before at the Dunwoody location tasted not like I remembered so i simply asked for a strawberry lemonade instead. Inconsistency in the dining experience is not what I expected. Next came our pizzas.  I explicitly ordered a cheese pizza, light cheese with extra sauce on the pizza and on the side. So out comes the pizza. Honestly this had to be the most poorly made pizza I've ever had at any California pizza kitchen location. No symmetry whatsoever, I had more crust than actual sauce, and I didn't get any sauce on the side. Okay,  sometimes people forget.  But when I reminded Seth about my extra side of sauce,  this gentleman proceeds to give me a nice COLD scoop of marinara sauce on a saucer. Not only did I touch the sauce and feel that it was ice cold, but I could clearly see Seth from my seat. WHY WOULD I WANT COLD SAUCE ON HOT PIZZA?? Seth seemed to find humor in that, obviously. At this point I am so over the entire thing and we ask for the check. Somehow Seth forgot I got the strawberry lemonade instead of the poorly made strawberry mango cooler because it was still on the check. Overall my guest and I had an extemely poor experience at the Atlantic Station location.

What is up with these people. It is 58 deg outside and they have the AC running. It is colder inside than outside In the middle of December. The pizza is good. I am just too cold to enjoy it. Spoke to the server who didn't care at all. Decided to have a coffee

Service is garbage, and employees are rude. Pizza and most of their food is frozen. Save yourself the hassle; buy a totinos from the grocery store and eat in the garage with the car running. About as much fun and twice as tastey.

Food was great really great. I love the Jamaican jerk pizza always my go to. The drink I ordered was delicious...honeybee lemonade. Only con was the bartender I get he was busy tending but he spent most of his time catching up with his friend than tending to me. Mind you it's a Wednesday night, the place is pretty empty and it's near closing. Maybe he was tired but it dropped y'all down two stars for service

Ridiculous experience. Showed up for St Pats celebration.  At 5:00 pm tried to get a table for 7 .  The two patio areas were not in use and I saw a few empty tables inside. Hostess tells us it will be an hour and a half to get a table. We asked to be seated outside. Hostess tells us it is a "server" issue (??) and that we can sit outside and wait for a table inside. We go to 2nd patio area and see a table of 4 being waited on. We seated ourselves and watched the server come and go several times to the other table, taking their order and serving food. Tried to get his attention but he would not even make eye contact with us. Finally ordered our food by placing to-go order at the bar. Meanwhile another group was seated and served in our patio area. Same server continued to avoid eye contact and would not acknowledge us Bartenders delivered our food to our table in to-go boxes We hauled our own drinks and silverware Throughout the night all but these three tables remained empty in the patio areas (10-15 tables) Management non-existent. And this was a heavily advertised planned event. Unbelievable

CPK is one of the better places to eat in Atlantic Station, and I've been to this specific location twice now. Once I came here on a date, and then the other time I came here for dinner with my boyfriend and his mom when she came to visit.  Ambiance: Dining inside in a booth provides a nice intimate setting, and the general setup of the restaurant is nice. When there aren't kids around it's a nice place to be for an evening dinner out.  Service: Service is pretty good, although there can sometimes be a long wait just to get in to the restaurant. I tried to come here once with a group of friends on a Friday night and ended up leaving because the wait was 45-60 min.  Food: The California club pizza is delicious! I've also tried two of their soups, the squash and the potato soups, and they were good too. I would recommend going for something a little more hearty though as two-in-a-bowl soups are not very filling.  Overall: If you want to go a sit-down restaurant in Atlantic Station then CPK is a great option.

I like to come to this CPK specially because when you dine in you can buy movie tickets for just $8.50 instead of $13.50 at the Regal's Box office. They mess up sometimes in the order, but they have great customer service taking care of the mistakes. The staff is very nice and polite and the restaurant is very clean!

Very bad customer service. Subpar food in comparison to the other California Pizza Kitchen's that I have been too. I went to the California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) in Atlantic Station for dinner last night out of convenience. I have been to this location of CPK twice before and have been disappointed in their pizzas and salads both times. However, I was set on getting pizza and didn't want Papa John's or Sarpino's so I went to CPK. Upon entrance, I asked the hostess where the takeout was. After an annoyed sigh, she said "Over there.. that way.. you see the sign.. in that corner." As I walked towards to take out sign in the very back corner of the restaurant, I still heard her shouting directions at me as I was walking away. I was shocked! The host/ess is the first impression of a restaurant and for her to be so rude and have such a terrible attitude was appalling. I contemplated turning around and walking out of the restaurant due to the very unfriendly welcome. She was a brunette and I believe her name was Tez.  Luckily I was greeted in a very friendly and welcoming manner by the women at the Take-Out counter. One of their name badges said Alex and I couldn't remember the other's name but she had dreadlocks. They were very nice in stark comparison to the hostess and brought out the manager for me to speak with about my experience while I waited for my food. I shared my experience with the manager and all that she said to me was "thank you for sharing." That was it.. No apology, just thank you. She then proceeded to walk over to the hostess and presumably discuss her behavior towards me while I was still in the restaurant! To make matter worse, once I got home about 5 minutes later, my pizza was cold. The cheese tasted very low quality for a CPK and it was just not good. The brownie that I got from there was as hard as a brick and lacked in flavor. I ended up throwing everything away and will not be frequently that California Pizza Kitchen again. Their other locations have much better customer service and great tasting food.

Had a decent experience here--food was fresh and came out quick. The Baja egg rolls were bland. The barley soup was nice and creamy. My crispy chicken sandwich's chicken was so thin I thought I was eating a flavored piece of hard taco shell.

I stopped here for dinner and a drink the other night, because it was just beautiful outside and I wanted to sit on their patio. My server was very kind and he even suggested that I get the discounted movie tickets, which I appreciate it. I had the asparagus and spinach pasta with salmon which was really nice, and their summer drink. I sat outside, watch the people pass, and had a really great relaxed evening. I would definitely come back here.

Stopped by with a friend and we were surprised how extensive the menu is. Our server Morgan was wonderful. She gave us plenty of time to look over the menu & was friendly. We shared the spinach dip as an appetizer and it was hands down the best spinach dip I've had in such a long time.  Their chips are thick and crispy vs the usual thin, oily chips at most places. I ordered the crispy thin margherita pizza! I was surprised how large it was for only being $14. We ate 4 slices and took 3 slices home, it's a pretty good deal. My friend ordered the garlic cream fettuccine!! Mmmmm! The sauce was delicious! We will definitely be back for a lunch date or dinner another time.
Solid CPK experience. The BBQ chicken pizza was good and so was the salad. Service was good as well.
The food is pretty much like other CA pizza. The dif is the service which makes it a 3 star to me.

We love this location. I'm a regular. The wait is always minimal, the service is good, and the food is hot and tasty. I recommend the Thai Crunch Salad and Mushroom Pizza. I would say the chicken and dumplings but I think they changed the recipe recently, so I don't enjoy them anymore. They taste microwaved and watered down. The cocktails at this location only in Atlanta area are always great!

Ordered takeout online, waited 30 minutes like it said to and when I went to get it the pizza was not ready and I had to wait almost 30 more minutes to receive it. It was only one pizza. Service sucks. Several people after me who also ordered takeout received their orders immediately. Would give 0 stars if possible would not go there ever again.
When ever I get the mushroom sausage pepperoni I think mustafa. That's from lion king

So pissed ... worst CPK i have ever been to.  Place was so filthy . No waiter for 15 min .. our waiter told us that they ran out of bread. He served us white milk with chocolate syrup and asked me to stir it to make it chocolate milk. All the tables and silverware were dirty. We ordered buffalo cauliflower as a starter..and we got served half cooked cauliflower with no flavor.  Just left the restaurant. Will be writing to senior management.

CPK is a solid consistent experience. It's in a great location. There's a parking garage. So, unless there's a big event, there's usually parking available. There are shops around and a movie theater. So great mix use community.  The restaurant has a nice size bar and plenty of seating for small and larger parties. The decor and atmosphere is relaxing and good for gatherings. The service was good and the restaurant was clean and well-kept. The food here is pretty good. It can sometimes be under seasoned and bland depending on what you order. I ordered the spinach and artichoke dip. It was ok. I wasn't too impressed. I also order a daiquiri. It was not good. But the butter cake is delicious. So moist and buttery. It's one of my favorite menu items there. The service was good and the restaurant was clean and well-kept. The prices are reasonable, but they could work on the quality/taste to match the price more fairly.  I did learn that CPK customers receive 50% off of their movie theater tickets at Regal Atlantic Station.

Generally I enjoy dining at CPK but not so much today. The food was pleasant but the service was deplorable. The front of the house staff was warm, friendly and inviting. However, our server was inattentive and aloof. We waited for 15 minutes to be greeted. In fact another server felt pity for us and offered to take our drink order. 5 minutes thereafter our actual server came to ask if we wanted drinks. We informed him that someone beat him to it and he appeared nonchalant. My guest and I requested bread...we're still waiting. The table next to us who were seated roughly 20 minutes after us were greeted promptly with smiles and eagerness. Their drinks arrived promptly and they ordered right away. I definitely don't feel like we received equal service for equal pay. I'm truly disappointed because this is not the service that I have grown accustomed to in my 20+ years patronizing CPK. Drew, you definitely need to step your game up as a server. ...still waiting for bread and my meal is practically done.

Why is this place so gross? Seriously. It's never clean and the staff never looks polished. For some reason, I get less food when I carry out. Tip: do not pay for toppings on the pasta b/c they will jip you. I literally got 4 small balls of chicken (the size of a dime) and 2 thin mushroom particles even though I paid and extra $5 for them. Oh, and don't expect any assistance or customer service efforts from Morgan. She is extremely rude - ignored me when I asked for more napkins. Will never go back. UPDATE: after leaving this review, the cpk social media team reached out to me to address it. but when they put me in touch w/the "managing partner" of this location, brandon, he never replied back. now we see why the customer service here is so dismal - it starts at the top.

I came here on a rainy day and had a good experience. I ordered the lettuce wraps with chicken and the lime agave margarita. The wraps were very delicious and very filling. They came with about 5 lettuce wraps with plenty of enough chicken to fill all 5 wraps.
Good variety for a break from the heat.  Lettuce wraps were excellent and low cal.  Service at the bar was very good.  Pizzas look good too.

I so enjoyed eating dinner there solo last night. Inside was busy and noisy so I chose to dine on the patio. The sky was slightly overcast and a slight breeze was blowing, which relaxed me instantly since I was subconscious eating alone. The waiter was personable and attentive, but he forgot to give me his name and I forgot to ask because I was starving, nevertheless, his recommendations were spot on. I sipped on the Beehive Sangria, which was sublimely refreshing. The complimentary French bread and dipping oil was tasty. The Jambalaya fettuccine was spicy, full of plump shrimp. This is definitely going to be one I will return to again and again. (  ³)

It has been a long time since I came to this location. The surrounding restaurants have definitely changed over the past couple of years. The Copeland's cheesecake restaurant is no longer around, which surprised me. For the purpose of this review, I will get back to the topic at hand. I went to CPK with a friend of mine on a Friday night. Given the time and Day I went, I expected to be a huge crowd. There was a huge crowd and I had to put my name on the list to be called. We were initially told that wait time would be 10 minutes, however we were waiting for about 20 minutes. I was very disappointed I figure it would take them time to clear off the tables. Our waiter was very nice and professional. For an appetizer, I had the spinach artichoke dip  and the five cheese + tomato pizza. The only reason why this review lost a star was because the pizza wasn't as warm as I would have liked it. I still enjoyed coming here.

I had my daughter's 15th birthday dinner here. CPK's management and wait staff did everything to accommodate our large group. Everything ran smoothly even though we had separate checks. None of the checks were wrong!!! That was a big plus. Our entire party of nearly 30 had a great meal together. Thank you for helping to give my baby a special birthday!!!

Mark and Chris (at the bar) made our experience absolutely amazing! They went above and beyond any expectation I ever thought about having. We placed a to go order and it was ready and right when I arrived. Our pizza was hot out of the oven! They gave us extra plates, napkins, silverware, etc to go with our order. They even invited us back after (or during) the concert in the park to have drinks. They went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed before we left. Really good food and amazing service. We will be back!

So I was not as pleased with CPK as I expected to be compared to my experience with the one in Birmingham, AL.  My first experience I had their pasta.  On this visit I decided to do the barbecue pizza off the lunch menu.  You get a soup or a salad with your entree.  I chose the potato soup and to my surprise it was not bad.  You just have to add a little salt! Now I was not impressed with the pizza. My coworkers and I walked about a mile there so I was pretty hungry.  It was not satisfying taste wise. Plus it was barely warm. The crust is not good and it's very thin.  The sauce was okay, nothing special.  Maybe it's because it's lunch but I wasn't impressed overall with the pizza selection. Service was okay. Upon being seated the staff were huddled in the corner looking, so my coworkers and I waited to see how long it would take for someone to come to our table, which was about 6-7min. It was only 3 total in our party.

It has been a very long time since I dined here. The restaurant is badly in need of some new chairs/tables. My tacos were more cabbage than fish and the fish was dry. The Thai Chicken spring rolls were served hot but gooey in the middle. Not exactly overwhelmed but the food. The service was great though. When using the restroom, the floor was a mess. Mentioned to the  server and it was promptly cared for.

Being a ex waitress I have high expectations for servers and expect my service to be A1 and that wasn't what we got. My friend had a birthday dinner party of 12 the wait took forever but when we were finally seated I guess the waitress was tired and ready to go because you can see it on her face she was throw down straws didn't speak to non of us I had to look up at her and say "hello how are you doing today" for her to even acknowledge us . She then walks away and didn't take our drink orders I had to tell her to order my drink. I know some of the people at our table was extremely loud but that don't have anything to do with her service. She finally took the rest of the drink orders after I got mine and I had to ask to put appetizers in so when she delivered them she didn't ask if we were ready to put in our entrees and half the table got their meal first. I wasn't pleased at all with her service but the food was delicious!

My boyfriend and friends decided to stop in for dinner before we headed out. Our party started with four people then it grew to five mid-way through the dinner. Our waiter Solomon immediately greeted us upon sitting and met everyone of our needs. We was personable and helpful throughout the entire experience. We ordered two shots, the sangria trio, a beer, the shrimp scampi pizza, and the California club. Our total came up to approximately 70 dollars, which, is a decent price for the amount of food and drinks we ordered. When the fifth member of our party came to the table, Solomon allowed us to pull up a seat and continue on with our dinner with no hesitations. Before we finished dinner we asked for additional bread and olive oil and every item we tried that night was delightful. This was an overall amazing experience. I hope the shrimp scampi pizza stays for a little while longer.  Overall the restaurant deserved an A. This is due to our awesome waiter, great food, family atmosphere, and decent wait time. Pitfalls, the pizza did take a little longer (this could be due to the large dinner crowd) and parking in this area may be confusing due to the numerous shops and eateries in the area.

This is a go to spot when your first choice is packed or you're looking to be served quickly. The food is good, but not great. The prices are fair. The environment is casual and perfect for its location. I would recommend it to anyone doing dinner and a movie in Atlantic Station.
The most pitful cobb salad I have ever ordered and it was $11.99 for a half a salad with barely any topping. My friend ordered pizza was premade and half frozen! Terrible!

The food is always consistent. Sit at the bar for a good time Mark and Chris will take good care of you! They hold their composures even when people put them under the burner they are super professional and sweet! I recommend CPK Atlantic Station!

Sometimes sitting at the bar will yield faster and better service. It was very busy at CPK and we decided to sit at the bar. We were in and out in less than 1 hour. The wait for a regular table was at least 20 min. The soup was good and the sangria's were on point. The bartender hooked us up. I think I'll be sitting at the bar next time I go. The service was really good!

I've been to this location all of twice & it's the perfect spot to get lunch on the town with your girls/guys because that's exactly what I did! My girls & I had a late lunch & our waiter Rodney was quite the gentlemen. "My pleasure"s after every statement & he tended to our every needy need. Oh yeah & the food was tasty!

I'll start by saying I really enjoyed the food here. Also the atmosphere is really inviting. Our waiter Chris was on point making very good recommendations. He also got our food out very quickly. Nothing I like more than an attentive waiter/waitress.  Thank you..
Delicious!! The whole area is so nice to walk around. It's very busy but very worth it! The pasta is really good and creamy! Will definitely be back.

So i walk in alone to be seated on December 30th stand by the host for 5 min. They look at me once n i smile and say hi, they lool away because i asssumed they were busy, but no a family of 5 walked in and they immediately took notice to them. I ate here once before. It was okay. I won't be returning here after that.  It was so obvious that i got ignored.  Shame
First time at California the Original BBQ Chicken Pizza recommended by Solomon was delicious as well as my flight of sangria.  Thank you!!
